medical_history.chief_complaint: Respiratory distress in a newborn boy admitted to the neonatal intensive care unit (NICU)
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient's symptoms began shortly after birth, developing subcostal retractions. The respiratory distress progressed and led to intubation and assisted ventilation. Various episodes of respiratory distress recurred over the first week of life.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient's mother had a history of intravenous drug abuse, hepatitis C virus infection, and bipolar disorder; the newborn had no relevant past medical conditions mentioned.
medical_history.family_history: The newborn had one healthy half-sibling; there was no family history of genetic abnormalities.
medical_history.social_history: The mother received regular prenatal care and lived in a shelter; during pregnancy, she was treated with methadone, clonazepam, clonidine, and iron supplements.
